  "description": "At Apex Pharmalabs, we are committed to delivering reliable healthcare solutions grounded in quality, convenience, and care. From prescriptions to laboratory diagnostics, we provide fast and dependable services tailored to each patient&rsquo;s needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job osition: Procurement Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	The Procurement Lead will oversee the sourcing, purchasing, and distribution of pharmaceutical products, medical supplies, and operational materials across all outlets of the pharmacy chain
	The role ensures cost?effective procurement, compliance with Nigerian regulatory standards, and timely delivery to branches, while maintaining strong supplier relationships and optimizing inventory management.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Procurement:


	Develop and implement procurement strategies aligned with company goals.
	Negotiate contracts with suppliers to secure favorable terms and pricing.
	Maintain strong supplier relationships and evaluate vendor performance.
	Ensure procurement aligns with Pharmacists Council of Nigeria (PCN) and NAFDAC regulations.


Operations &amp; Distribution:


	Coordinate stock distribution across multiple outlets nationwide.
	Monitor inventory levels and forecast demand to prevent shortages or overstocking.
	Approve inter?branch stock transfers and ensure accurate documentation.
	Collaborate with logistics partners for timely delivery.


Compliance &amp; Risk Management:


	Ensure all purchases comply with Nigerian pharmaceutical regulations.
	Maintain documentation for audits and inspections.
	Implement internal controls to prevent fraud, waste, and inefficiency.


Financial Management:


	Work closely with Finance Officer to track procurement budgets.
	Provide monthly procurement reports to management.
	Identify cost?saving opportunities without compromising quality.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Pharmacy, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	3-5 years of experience in procurement, ideally in retail pharmacy, FMCG, or healthcare.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian pharmaceutical regulations (PCN, NAFDAC).
	Excellent negotiation and vendor management skills.
	Proficiency in ERP or procurement software.
	Analytical mindset with attention to detail.
	Strong leadership and communication skills.


Salary
N320,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;&nbsp;recruitment@apexpharmalab.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Procurement Lead Job at Apex Pharmalabs




        
    

        
        At Apex Pharmalabs, we are committed to delivering reliable healthcare solutions grounded in quality, convenience, and care. From prescriptions to laboratory diagnostics, we provide fast and dependable services tailored to each patient’s needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job osition: Procurement Lead

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	The Procurement Lead will oversee the sourcing, purchasing, and distribution of pharmaceutical products, medical supplies, and operational materials across all outlets of the pharmacy chain
	The role ensures cost?effective procurement, compliance with Nigerian regulatory standards, and timely delivery to branches, while maintaining strong supplier relationships and optimizing inventory management.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Procurement:


	Develop and implement procurement strategies aligned with company goals.
	Negotiate contracts with suppliers to secure favorable terms and pricing.
	Maintain strong supplier relationships and evaluate vendor performance.
	Ensure procurement aligns with Pharmacists Council of Nigeria (PCN) and NAFDAC regulations.


Operations & Distribution:


	Coordinate stock distribution across multiple outlets nationwide.
	Monitor inventory levels and forecast demand to prevent shortages or overstocking.
	Approve inter?branch stock transfers and ensure accurate documentation.
	Collaborate with logistics partners for timely delivery.


Compliance & Risk Management:


	Ensure all purchases comply with Nigerian pharmaceutical regulations.
	Maintain documentation for audits and inspections.
	Implement internal controls to prevent fraud, waste, and inefficiency.


Financial Management:


	Work closely with Finance Officer to track procurement budgets.
	Provide monthly procurement reports to management.
	Identify cost?saving opportunities without compromising quality.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Pharmacy, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	3-5 years of experience in procurement, ideally in retail pharmacy, FMCG, or healthcare.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian pharmaceutical regulations (PCN, NAFDAC).
	Excellent negotiation and vendor management skills.
	Proficiency in ERP or procurement software.
	Analytical mindset with attention to detail.
	Strong leadership and communication skills.


Salary
N320,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:  recruitment@apexpharmalab.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "title": "Sales / Merchandise Executive",
  "description": "Eneight Limited - We are professionals in Product branding, merchandising, digital signages and experiential marketing which include solutions such as video walls, interactive kiosks, LED displays and customized software products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales / Merchandise Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Sanctuary, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job&nbsp;Description


	Post and manage product listings on online platforms such as Jumia, Jiji, Facebook Marketplace, etc.
	Respond promptly to customer inquiries, providing product information and assistance.
	Create compelling video and picture content showcasing our fitness products for online marketing purposes.
	Foster positive customer relationships through effective communication and responsiveness.
	Gather customer feedback and insights to improve product offerings and online shopping experience.
	Greet and assist customers in a friendly and professional manner.
	Understand the features and benefits of merchandise products, including fitness apparel and accessories.
	Provide product knowledge and guidance to customers, helping them make informed purchasing decisions.
	Maintain a clean and organized merchandise display, ensuring products are properly stocked and presented attractively.
	Process sales transactions accurately and efficiently using the point-of-sale system.
	Upsell and cross-sell merchandise items to maximize sales opportunities.
	Stay updated on industry trends, new product releases, and promotions to effectively communicate information to customers.
	Address customer inquiries and resolve issues or concerns in a timely and satisfactory manner.
	You shall take stock of products accurately.
	Assist in inventory management by conducting regular stock checks and reporting discrepancies to the store manager.
	Any other duties as required by Management.


Requirements


	HND / BSc in Sales, Marketing or any related courses
	1-3years of experience in the same field
	Excellent communication and customer relationship
	Persuasive selling skills, with the ability to articulate value propositions.
	Proven experience in direct sales, field sales, or customer-facing roles, with a track record of achieving sales targets and generating revenue.
	Results-driven attitude, with a sense of urgency, persistence, and determination to achieve sales goals and overcome challenges.
	Benefit is centered on Sales commission, conveyanceand phone call allowance
	Applicants must reside Paippe, Wuse, Gishiri, Maitama Village, Katampe


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;eneightltdrecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

	Post and manage product listings on online platforms such as Jumia, Jiji, Facebook Marketplace, etc.
